entry.dcterms:title: Changes in the Notions of Justice 1996. Hungarian population data.
entry.dcterms:creator: Nagy, Ildikó

entry.dcterms:subject: 2004-03-00: the labels of the data file are corrected and complemented
entry.dcterms:description: the survey is part of the international comparative empirical survey series which examined the evaluation and acceptance of the various aspects of social justice in 1991 in 12 countries, and then in 1996 in 7 countries (out of this repeated in 5 countries)
entry.dcterms:subject: science and technology
income, property and savings
mass political behavior, attitudes
equality and inequality
political institutions, public administration
cultural activities and participation
social stratification and groupings
person
survey data
time-series
Multi-stage proportionately stratified national probability sample representative of the adult Hungarian population. Respondents were selected using the Leslie Kish key and the random walking method.
face-to-face interview
A
